intro: Vernonia candelabricephala, commonly known as the candlestick vernonia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems that resemble a candlestick, hence its common name. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flower heads that are typically arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. The botanical features of Vernonia candelabricephala make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in native plant gardens.
